etymology.description: phonetic: 每 + semantic: 攴 ('hand; action'; sometimes written as 又 'hand' in early forms)
etymology.interpretation: Sound is borrowed from 每, while 攴 contributes the sense of the hand acting or striking. Together they evoke quick, deft movement and responsiveness, aligning with meanings like quick, nimble, and sensitive. Early forms sometimes used 又 for the hand element, reinforcing the action/hand idea.

examples.chinese: 他反应敏捷(他反應敏捷)，很快做出决定(很快做出決定)。
examples.pinyin: Tā fǎnyìng mǐnjié, hěn kuài zuòchū juédìng.
examples.english: He reacts quickly and makes decisions swiftly.

examples.chinese: 她对气味很敏感(她對氣味很敏感)，一点烟味都能闻出来(一點煙味都能聞出來)。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì qìwèi hěn mǐngǎn, yīdiǎn yānwèi dōu néng wén chūlái.
examples.english: She is very sensitive to smells and can detect even a trace of smoke.

examples.chinese: 这位学生思维敏锐(這位學生思維敏銳)，提出了独到的见解(提出了獨到的見解)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi xuéshēng sīwéi mǐnruì, tíchū le dúdào de jiànjiě.
examples.english: This student thinks sharply and offered original insights.
